bibl.title: Letter from F.M. Boldridge to Henry Rose Carter, January 9, 1921

div1.p: Boldridge is sending Carter a copy of “Effective Malaria Control in a Ricefield District”. He praises Carter's publications on public health sanitary engineering.

div1.head: Letter from F.M. Boldridge to Henry Rose Carter, January 9, 1921
div1.opener:
GEO. W. BYARS
MAYOR
J. H. McLURE
CITY ENG. AND TREAS.
F.M. BOLDRIDGE
HEALTH OFFICER
MARION & MARION
CITY ATTORNEYS
BOARD OF ALDERMEN
W. A. COLN
J. H. HAMILTON
O. A. LEE
J. A. NICHOLS
J. T. PEAY
D. M. PEDEN
W. C. WHITE
F. L. WHITLOCK
CITY OF CHESTER
SOUTH CAROLINA
CHESTER, S. C.
Health Department,
Jan 9th 1921.
Asst. Surg. Gen. H.R. Carter,
#2121 California St, N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Enclosed herewith is a copy of “Effective Malaria
Control in a Ricefield District”, with Observations on Experimental
Mosquito Flights, by GEIGER, PURDY and TARBETT.

I certainly hope this is what you want as it is the
only thing I have on the work done at Lonoke.

If you wish you may keep this copy and I will try
and secure another.

I have been reading with a great deal of interest
your articles that have been appearing in The Public Health Engin-
eering Abstracts. I have profited by these articles and am sure they are
doing a great deal of good.

I expect to attend the Public Health Institute in
Washington in May and I notice you are on the program.

Certainly hope you are enjoying the very best of
health.
